data.title: Retro Atmosphere and awesome food
data.text: So, we discovered this restaurant which is upstairs above another restaurant on Victorian Ave in Sparks about 5 years ago. We love i. Great food. Huge menu with so many choices.  And the staff makes us feel like family. Real tablecloths and Napkins. Great service.  And entertainment I think Thursday evenings through the weekends.  "Rat Pack" music I call it. Real people singing real songs of the greats.  Dean Martin, Frank Sinatra, Tony Bennett, etc.  So cool.  Everyone should try it. Best parking is behind the building. Then go up the fairly steep flight of,stairs through the back door.

data.title: Good Italian
data.text: Eaten here over the years. Well prepared Italian food. Good service. Adequate proportions. Entertainment on occasion.

data.title: Meraviglioso!
data.text:
We did not read any reviews for this restaurant and ended up here thanks to our Garmin GPS of all things!   Well played Garmin.

The low key restaurant entrance we used is located facing the Victorian Square plaza and co-located with a bar so we walked down a hallway and were presented with stairs that led to a glass door and great dining experience.

The wait staff were all smartly dressed and the service was proper, punctual and polite.  Our waiter got thru the entire specials list without a hitch and it was quite a detailed list I might add.  I even noticed that they attempted to serve and pour from the proper sides of the guest using correct posture and arm positioning.  They did not hover but were never too far away to take care of us whenever we looked for them.  Big points for this execution of etiquette usually seen at very expensive high end eateries but totally relevant to this upscale restaurant.

The fresh bread and soup were tasty while dinner of Costolette di Agnello and Salmone della Famiglia was outstanding followed by Tiramisu and cheesecake desert.  What a culinary delight found by chance!  This place is the real deal for great Italian food.

data.title: Every patron is "Famiglia"
data.text: Have been dining here for years. Food and service outstanding. But had an experience last night that showed us the true character and meaning of Pietro's Familglia. To Pietro, every guest is famiglia, a member of his family, and is treated as such. Most fine restaurants make you feel special while dining. Pietro takes this one step further.

data.title: A nice alternative to chain restaurants
data.text:
This family owned restaurant is located upstairs on Victorian Square in Sparks. While I would not consider it wheel chair friendly, there is an elevator from the first floor of the building. 
The menu is extensive with prices ranging from the low teens for pasta dishes to around $30 for the specials. Servings are large and plan on taking some home for most of the dishes. I recommend the lamb chops especially if you have a large appetite.
On the night that we were there, the table in front of us was occupied by two guys who spent the entire night seeing how many "F" words they could work into a sentence. Not very family friendly.
Overall, not sure it's worth another visit unless with maybe a 2 for 1 coupon.

data.title: Great Italian Food!
data.text: Thursday - Sunday they have a singer throughout your meal that adds to the charm of this quaint Italian place.  The menu had many choices but were VERY receptive to making it just the way YOU want it!  Great food and service! And in a neat area of Sparks, 15 minutes from downtown Reno.

data.title: Disappointing
data.text:
Maybe it was all the hype, but we were really disappointed in this restaurant. We had heard about the food and the guy who sings the Frank Sinatra songs and so we decided to celebrate a birthday there. We made reservations for four early on a Saturday evening. When we got there, we were seated in the back of the restaurant...even though there were plenty of seats up front. 

We selected our appetizers, and then the server suggested we get a different one that included the two we had ordered. What he didn't say was that it was more than twice the cost of the two we ordered. Everything was an up sale. We ordered our entree, and were asked "soup or salad with that?" The way it was worded made it sound like it came with the meal...it didn't. Again, it was an additional cost. Don't get me wrong, we don't mind paying good money for good food, but I don't like feeling like the server was being sneaky. 

The food was just okay. My husband's pasta was overcooked and my veggie lasagne was huge, but didn't have much going on. I asked our server what was in it before I ordered it and his response was "vegetables." I asked if there was a lot of spinach in it and he said no. Well, I think I found one carrot and a few zuchinis, but the rest of it was nothing but spinach. The chocolate mousse cake was the best thing we ate.

As for the entertainment that we were looking forward to, we asked when the singer would begin and whether we would be able to hear him in the back where we were. We were told that he moves around and sings at each table, so we would definitely be able to hear him. Well, he never moved...stayed on the stage with a small speaker, so we couldn't hear him. Again, we made reservations days in advance...for early evening. Surprised that we got stuck in the back.

Disappointing all the way around. Don't plan to go back.

data.title: Incredible Italian eats
data.text: Is that Sinatra at that table? The atmosphere is classic 50s, the food is just classic Italian.  Four of us split three appetizers, entrees, Caesar salad, and Canole dessert. The only disappointment was we couldn't eat more. Our table favorite was the Seafood Cioppino although the crab filled Manicotti was spectacular.  Gotta do this.

data.title: Always a favorite!
data.text: This is our favorite place to go for Italian food.  Everything is awesome, the atmosphere, the service and of course the food!  Love the live music as well.  We have never been disappointed.

data.title: Delicious food, excellent service.
data.text: We have eaten at Pietro's  several times and each time it is fantastic!  Our guests love it and everyone orders different dishes and is amazed at how delicious everything is.  It is a family staple!

data.title: Excellent food and service
data.text: We were a 10 top and they seated us no problem. They were able to split our check in all sorts of ways (graciously). Great wine list, menu and specials. Some of the best scallops I've had.

data.title: Best Italian food we ever had.
data.text: I saw a review that this was the best Italian restaurant in town so that's all I needed to make a reservation. We weren't disappointed. The second we walked in, I felt like we were in an old-fashioned east coast Italian restaurant. Beginning with the Italian décor but not ending with the singer knocking out Frank Sinatra tunes, we sat and enjoyed some great wine and really well-made Manhattans. The main courses of clams linguine, raviolis, shrimp and salmon were the tastiest we ever had. The only thing we were sorry about was that we didn't have enough room left for dessert. I highly recommend Pietro's to anyone who loves really great Italian food.

data.title: Pietro's Famiglia is a must have
data.text: I stop in and eat here every time I'm in Reno for a business conference. The sea scallops with the mushroom risotto is absolutely the best I have ever had and the whole reason I make a point to eat here whenever I can!

data.title: Coupon Brought Us An Excellent Meal
data.text: My husband and I chose this restaurant due to a discount coupon we received. We like to try new places and will eventually be moving to the Sparks area. We have eaten at several places in Victoria Square area and have yet to be disappointed. This was no exception. Though it is in an odd little building there is an elevator for anyone that cannot climb the steps to the second floor which houses the restaurant. It is a more dated décor but I thought it was interesting and unique. Our waiter Isaac was a very friendly young man, very attentive, and seemed to enjoy his job. All the staff was friendly and welcoming. We tried two of the specials for the evening and they were excellent! The house salad that was included was perfect. We really enjoyed our evening. They are only open for dinner.  We will be back!! Maybe next time we will be there when the gentleman sings the old crooner songs.

data.title: BEST Restaurant in Sparks Reno Area
data.text: BEST Restaurant in Reno Sparks area.   Been to Reno maybe 1/2 dozen times and have hit many restaurants.  On this last trip we went to Pietro's & it was unbelievable.  We were 3 brothers who had the 1) Scallops 2)Salmon & shrimp 3)The Lamb.. The Salmon & Lamb were specials that came with huge delicious shrimp.  The Salmon was so moist & flavorful, over a delicious bed of angel hair pasta & spinach. Each dish portion size was big.  The dishes here are so darn good! The owner, Pietro, a super nice guy, is the Chef!  They have it nailed down here with Presentation, Big Portions but most of all Flavor.., all 3 dishes were DELICIOUS.  We had a VG waiter, Chad.. very polite, friendly & professional.  The LoRusso's will be back!

data.title: What happened to Pietro's"
data.text:
Pietro's was one of our favorite restaurants since moving here three years ago; the cuisine was very good, service excellent, and the ambience just funky enough for a pleasant dining experience. We eat there on the average of every four to six weeks, and sometimes more often when we have out of town guests. But something has happened in the last six months and not for the better.

Last night Jackie ordered the Chicken Alfredo. What she received was chicken on a bed of pasta bereft of Alfredo sauce; no butter, no cream, no cheese, and the garlic was burnt. My Veal Piccata was no better; a strange breaded pasty mess and a watery gruel that was supposed to be mushroom risotto. We couldn't eat either. I had mine boxed to be polite because we like the waiter but dumped it in a garbage can in the downstairs bar.

The degradation of the place showed in other ways as well. It was seven o'clock on a Saturday evening and it was half full/empty. Not a good sign for any restaurant. All this seems to coincide with the departure of a senior bus person who seemed to hold some sway with the operation of the restaurant, and on occasion sometimes cooked. Mere coincidence?

Despite a sheer fondness for the staff and ambience, it will be awhile before we go back.

data.title: Pietros not Pedro.  Not impressed
data.text:
Not sure how to report an incorrect name on tripadvisor. 
Located upstairs from a seedy looking bar. 
Place looks tired and worn out. 
We were a party of 6.  Too noisy to have a conversation with anyone except with the person next to you unless you spoke louder than you usually would. It got better when the music and live singing stopped after 9 pm, but not much. 
The fried calamari appetizer, house salad,  chicken cacciatore were less than average.  The pasta with clams with white sauce was pretty good.  It had a tangy lemon flavor.  The chianti was good.  
Service was very good.
Cost about $56 per person, which included 5 cocktails,  2 bottles of chianti,  2 appetizers and 6 entrees (each included soup or salad) and tip.  Not unreasonable,  but the ambience, noise and quality of food not worth going back to.

data.title: hidden gem
data.text: We found this restaurant while visiting Reno.  It was upstairs in a funky building surrounded by bars.  The decorations are a little dated and cliche, with a single fake flower in a vase on each table.  We were the only people in there.  The waiter brought out bread that was mediocre at best.  It tasted like that pre-seasoned garlic bread from the supermarket- too salty, and powdered garlic flavor.  Then we got the soup.  Super delicious home-made minestrone.  It wasn't tomato based like some minestrones, but was full of herbs and veggies.  It was exactly what I wanted after a day of skiing.  I would have been happy with just a bowl of soup, it was that good.  I ordered penne puttanesca, and it was perfect.  I could tell the sauce was homemade.  The portion was huge and I took home half of it.  I would have preferred half the portion and fresh pasta (not dried), but for the price, it was good.  The sauce was just awesome, full of whole capers and large chunks of kalamata olives.  My husband had linguine with seafood in a white wine garlic sauce.  I had a bite and it was good,  It was full of huge pieces of various seafood.  We didn't have dessert.  The specials and desserts sounded amazing though.

data.title: It's Pietro's not Pedros!!
data.text: This has to be one of my favorite Italian places to eat in the Reno / Sparks area. It's small and a little hard to find but some of the best places are. My wife is Italian and we've eaten Italian all over the country as well as Italy and this rates right up there with the best. It's located on the second floor of the building with access from the front or rear by stairs only but worth every step. Great food, good wine, and desert if you have room.

data.title: Good Food, Excellent Service
data.text: The food was very good. We had the fried calamari, and two of the evening specials, scallops in a tomato and white wine sauce over pasta and salmon and shrimp in the same sauce over pasta. The calamari was perfectly cooked as were the scallops and salmon. The meals came with soup or salad and bread. The soup, pasta fagioli, was forgettable and the salad was fine. We split an excellent tiramisu and a very nice bottle of wine that the waiter recommended. The service was excellent. I would certainly recommend this place if you're looking for a nice place to eat.
